recommendations: August 23, 2015, Michael was a client of Eric’s

August 23, 2015, Deen worked with Michael in the same group

When I first met Deen I wasn't sure what to think. He's very outgoing, generous, and eager to learn new things. A friend of mine and him sat down and showed him some code that was running slowly on our current project and we ended up talking for a few hours, going over various ways to speed it up and finally partially implementing a stored procedure in MySQL to fix the problem. That was on a friday. Over the weekend Deen and gone through and found other weakness in the DB, made suggestions on field and relationship changes, and finished a stored procedure that increased the speed of that method by ~ 400%.That was the beginning of our work relationship. Over time I lead a new project and had to form a team that understood our goals and were creative enough to solve tough data problems in a new way. I chose Deen to lead the database side and we worked well together. Every day we would debate possible implementations, go over his new changes, and talk about support issues. I never regretted bringing Deen in. He was one of the most insightful, intelligent, reliable self starters on the team. I could always rely on being able to give some vague idea to him and have him implement the best approach for that. In the times that we disagreed on an implementation, he was always willing to sit down and understand the problem better through discussion.So, if you're looking for a smart, well rounded, precise architect, Deen gets my highest recommendation.

summary: As an established web applications developer with ~20 years of professional experience, I have focused on building applications for start ups, small/medium/large businesses, and web services. I've used lots of technologies over that period including Erlang/Elixir, Java, Ruby, Node, Javascript, Golang, C#, and Python.I'm versatile in SQL and NoSQL databases choosing PostgreSQL and MongoDb as my favorites in those two disciplines.I am experienced working in small teams or by himself, and am very comfortable leading and building teams for projects; it's not uncommon to lead remote teams.As well, I have over 10 years of experience managing projects, from pitching the initial ideas, to hiring, leading, coding, documenting, and launching the finished product.I'm looking to work with people who are my peers or better; people who push and challenge me; people who know there is no end to the future of tech and are excited to be a continuous part of that future.
name: Michael Christenson II
title: Senior Software Applications Engineer at Red Hat
